page.title: 20Local History
page.content: At first sight there is little to suggest that Sale possesses historical origins outside the 20th century. However, some traces of its earlier history remain, eg the main highway, the A56 which follows the course of the Roman road, Watling Street; the Bridgewater Canal, substantially unchanged in appearance, but now used solely by pleasure craft; several houses and cotages dating from the 18th and early 19th centuties; a dove cote near the M63 roundabout, marking the site of Sale Old Hall. The most important pointers to Sale's develop -ment are the stations at Sale and Brooklands. Sale opened in 1849 and turned a rural community into a dormitory and commuter suburb for Manchester. Ther many fine, large Victorian houses(sought-after)witness Sale's 19th century development.
